globalMetadata.title: Good Thinking - NHS approved wellbeing service
globalMetadata.description: Anxious, stressed, depressed or having trouble sleeping? Find NHS-approved mental health tools and advice to support you.

howToUseSection.bodyText:
Find support, advice and resources by:

  • Mental health concern

Sleep, Anxiety, Low mood, Stress.

  • Audience

Young people, Employers and employees, Someone who is grieving, Faith and belief communities.

  • Type of support

Self-assessments, quick quizzes, free apps, podcasts, videos, how to guides, workbooks.

attributes.alternativeText: Person using a desktop computer
attributes.name: Person using desktop computer.png

howToUseSection.bodyText:
Get expert advice from Good Thinking

The Good Thinking team has created a broad range of advice in collaboration with clinical and subject-area experts, designed to support Londoners with everyday mental health challenges.

In our Latest Advice section, you'll find short guides with tips and resource recommendations to help you with a range of concerns including dealing with uncertainty, money worries, getting enough sleep and coping with bereavement. 

If you’re looking for advice on a specific subject, type in your topic in the ‘search﻿’ box at the top of the page.

attributes.alternativeText: Hands holding a tablet showing a Good Thinking page

thumbnail.name: thumbnail_Hand holding a tablet showing a Good Thinking page.png

attributes.name: Hand holding a tablet showing a Good Thinking page.png

howToUseSection.bodyText:
Use the Good Thinking self-assessment tool

Our in-depth, clinically validated self-assessments are a thorough assessment of both your mental and physical wellbeing. They may seem quite ‘medical’ because they are based on the types of questions a doctor or a psychologist might ask you.

  • Each self-assessment takes around 20 minutes to complete
  • Answer questions about yourself or someone you may be concerned about
  • You’ll get a personalised list of recommended actions to take forward

attributes.alternativeText: Person using a laptop to do self-assessment

thumbnail.name: thumbnail_Person using laptop to do self-assessment.png

attributes.name: Person using laptop to do self-assessment.png

howToUseSection.bodyText:
Take the Good Thinking quiz

Take one of our quizzes on anxiety, sleep, low mood and stress.

Answer three simple questions, such as “How often are you affected by this?”, and you’ll then receive personalised recommendations for apps and other resources to help you.

metadata.description: Anxious, stressed, depressed or having trouble sleeping? Find NHS-approved mental health tools and advice to support you.
metadata.title: Digital mental health and wellbeing support for Londoners

attributes.alternativeText: Group of friends sitting on grass in front of London skyline
attributes.name: OG Image.png

slides.headline: Digital mental wellbeing for London
slides.description: Good Thinking supports Londoners to look after their mental health and wellbeing in a way that works for them. Since its launch in 2017, more than 750,000 people have used our digital service to tackle anxiety, stress, low mood, sleep problems and other concerns.

attributes.alternativeText: Group of friends sitting on grass in front of London skyline
attributes.name: OG Image.png

buttonLink.text: Start your journey with Good Thinking

slides.headline: Support your employees with free NHS-approved resources
slides.description: We know it can be time-consuming to find good quality free resources that support your employee wellbeing strategy. Good Thinking have created a toolkit to help employers create a safe and supportive workplace in these challenging times.

attributes.alternativeText: Images of a doctor, someone doing a presentation, a brick-layer and a bus driver
attributes.name: Employees.png

slides.headline: Looking out for those around you
slides.description: Knowing if someone is struggling with their mental health or how to help a family member, friend or colleague when you are worried about them can be difficult. Check out Good Thinking's new guides which give three simple steps to help you to check in with people and help them to get the support that they need.

attributes.alternativeText: Smartphone displaying a heart
attributes.name: phone-shape.png

slides.headline: Mental health resources created by black students for black students
slides.description: We've partnered with the Office for Students' Black Students Mental Health Project at London South Bank University to host a fantastic range of support developed by over 600 students.

attributes.alternativeText: Office for Students Black Students Mental Health Project at LSBU logo
attributes.name: LSBU X GT logo_Instagram.png

slides.headline: Cost of living advice
slides.description: Money worries can have a serious impact on your mental health. If you are feeling stressed or anxious, Good Thinking have put together advice and practical tips to help you stay mentally healthy, alongside links to financial support services and organisations.

attributes.alternativeText: Person sitting at a desk worrying about money

large.name: large_Person at desk worrying about bills.png

small.name: small_Person at desk worrying about bills.png

medium.name: medium_Person at desk worrying about bills.png

thumbnail.name: thumbnail_Person at desk worrying about bills.png

attributes.name: Person at desk worrying about bills.png

slides.headline: Get Feeling Good for free!
slides.description: Feeling Good is now completely free for Londoners via Good Thinking! The app is scientifically proven to lift your mood and help recovery from stress, anxiety and depression using audio tracks to train your mind to be more relaxed.

attributes.alternativeText: Feeling Good app logo
attributes.name: Feeling_Good_Logo.max-165x165.png

buttonLink.text: Learn more and download for FREE
